poem:
### The Allure of K-Beauty

On high streets  
a slick sheen—  
snail's trail, silken  
promise of salmon—  
drifts from screen  
to skin.  
  
In the glass bright  
of tomorrow's mirror,  
we paint dreams  
of worlds within,  
where secrets whisper  
and shimmer,  
captured  
in a pearl's gleam.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "From snail slime to salmon sperm: the K-beauty boom hits UK high streets Korean beauty products are moving from phone screens to UK high streets as social media drives sales of skincare with the help of eye-catching ingredients such as snail slime and salmon sperm. Retailers are looking to capitalise on the TikTok and Instagram trend for skincare and makeup ranges from South Korea – known as K-beauty – by opening physical stores and launching". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
